title.value: FETA: Fairness Enforced Verifying, Training, and Predicting Algorithms for Neural Networks
title.justification: This is the title of the paper as presented by the user
title.quote: FETA: Fairness Enforced Verifying, Training, and Predicting Algorithms for Neural Networks

extractions.description: The paper introduces techniques to verify, train, and predict individual fairness in neural network models. It proposes a tool called FETA, which incorporates counterexample-guided methods to guarantee fairness constraints during prediction and training. The effectiveness of these techniques is demonstrated through empirical evaluations on real-world datasets.

type.justification: The paper employs empirical evaluations on real-world datasets to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed techniques.
type.quote: Empirical evaluations on real-world benchmark datasets demonstrate the effectiveness of our solutions to train fair and accurate models, while provably guaranteeing fairness at the prediction time.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on ensuring fairness in machine learning models, particularly neural networks.
name.quote: In this paper, we study the problem of verifying, training and guaranteeing individual fairness of neural network models.

name.justification: The paper includes methods that involve adversarial training to enforce fairness constraints.
name.quote: ...we propose a novel counterexample-guided algorithm to incorporate fairness during training...

name.justification: The paper extensively discusses verifying fairness constraints using neural network verification methods.
name.quote: Our approach. This paper develops techniques to detect, incorporate and guarantee individual fairness constraints for all points in the input space to a standard ReLU neural network without imposing further restrictions on the hypothesis space...

name.justification: FETA is the proposed tool in the paper which incorporates the authors' techniques for fairness verification, training, and prediction.
name.quote: We have implemented our algorithms in a tool called “Fairness Enforced Verifying, Training, and Predicting Algorithm” (FETA).

aliases: Fairness Enforced Verifying, Training, and Predicting Algorithm

is_contributed.justification: FETA is the main contribution of the paper as it implements the proposed fairness verification, training, and prediction algorithms.
is_contributed.quote: We have implemented our algorithms in a tool called “Fairness Enforced Verifying, Training, and Predicting Algorithm” (FETA).

is_executed.justification: The paper mentions empirical evaluations, which implies that the model was executed to obtain results.
is_executed.quote: Empirical evaluation on real-world datasets indicates that FETA is not only able to guarantee fairness on-the-fly at prediction time but also is able to train accurate models exhibiting a much higher degree of individual fairness.

is_compared.justification: The paper compares FETA to other models and approaches to demonstrate its effectiveness.
is_compared.quote: Table 5 reports the accuracy and CE Rate of FETA compared to a recent method called LCIFR (Ruoss et al., 2020) that mitigates individual fairness using the same fairness definition as ours (i.e., Definition 3.1).

referenced_paper_title.value: FETA: Fairness Enforced Verifying, Training, and Predicting Algorithms for Neural Networks
referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference paper for the model is the same as the paper being analyzed.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We have implemented our algorithms in a tool called “Fairness Enforced Verifying, Training, and Predicting Algorithm” (FETA).

name.justification: This dataset is used in the empirical evaluation of the proposed methods.
name.quote: This dataset consists of 1k samples... The main task is binary classification of good or bad credit risks.

referenced_paper_title.justification: This dataset is well-known and referenced as Statlog (German Credit Data) Data Set.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Hofmann, H. Statlog (german credit data) data set.

name.justification: This dataset is used in the empirical evaluation of the proposed methods.
name.quote: The initial Adult dataset is used for binary classification of whether an individual’s salary is above or below $50k.

referenced_paper_title.value: Retiring Adult: New Datasets for Fair Machine Learning
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper provides references for the reconstructed Adult dataset.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Ding, F., Hardt, M., Miller, J., and Schmidt, L. Retiring adult: New datasets for fair machine learning.

name.justification: This dataset is used in the empirical evaluation of the proposed methods.
name.quote: This dataset, consisting of 86k samples, gathers law school admission records and is used for predicting if an individual would pass the bar exam.

referenced_paper_title.value: LSAC National Longitudinal Bar Passage Study
referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset is referred to as the Law School dataset and is documented in the LSAC National Longitudinal Bar Passage Study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Wightman, L. S. LSAC National Longitudinal Bar Passage Study.

name.justification: The paper mentions the use of PyTorch for implementing the experiments.
name.quote: Experiments are implemented in Python using Pytorch.
